column4: hi, i'm having huge problems with ubuntu. i was playing quake4 and it just crashed, so i had to do a manual restart, then i re-loaded, quake4 wouldn't run, neither would xmms, so i do another manual restart and xserver doesn't run.

hi, i'm having huge problems with ubuntu. i was playing quake4 and it just crashed, so i had to do a manual restart, then i re-loaded, quake4 wouldn't run, neither would xmms, so i do another manual restart and xserver doesn't run.

hi, i'm having huge problems with ubuntu. i was playing quake4 and it just crashed, so i had to do a manual restart, then i re-loaded, quake4 wouldn't run, neither would xmms, so i do another manual restart and xserver doesn't run. I think i'm going to install kde and see if that helps

hi, i'm having huge problems with ubuntu. i was playing quake4 and it just crashed, so i had to do a manual restart, then i re-loaded, quake4 wouldn't run, neither would xmms, so i do another manual restart and xserver doesn't run. I think i'm going to install kde and see if that helps
What kind of errors does it generate when X tries to start?
i don't know, it freezes before i can do anything
does it bring you to the graphical login screen?
When you boot up, I mean, or does it crash before then?
i get the loading ubuntu screen, then it all goes black and i have to restart
That sounds bad.  I think it's probably beyond my ability to fix.  But one thing that might help is to switch desktops away from the graphical bootup screen so you can see what step it fails on
yeah, i think i'm done with computers now
i just lost a good weeks worth of source code + quake4 saved games
It sounds like it might have done something bad to your hard drive, maybe the drive failing is what caused it in the first place
It's certainly worth taking the hard drive out and trying to read it on another machine to see if it's really hashed or if the linux install just got wrecked
i can run as root easily
Oh.  Well, I'm kind of at a loss, then.
I thought it might be something easy, like a problem with the .ICEauthority file like I always have
You might need to manually mount the CD.  Can you browse it?
